review_blob: Pours a rich copper colour, clear but with medium-heavy carbonation. Lacy, small but lasting white head. Coppery, dried herb and roasty malt aromas. Smooth, balanced initial malt flavouring, bready with light notes of melted butter. Light to medium bodied and lightly sweet, with a light and slightly spicy lasting dry hoppy bitterness coating the tongue and upper palate. Very sessionable, excellent on the palate and with surprising depth of flavour.

Can from International Beer Shop, Perth, poured into IPA glass. 
Pours clear and deep copper in appearance, lightly carbonated, with a settling white head. 
Aroma is sweet, slightly bready and nutty, with dominant pine and orange hoppy scents. 
Taste is medium sweet, slightly bitter at first with light bready notes, with flavours as for the aroma but with additional malt characteristics, ending in a light lingering bitterness.
Complex and very well balanced throughout.

330ml bottle into Spiegelau IPA glass, purchased from International Beer Shop, Perth.
Pours a light golden colour, highly carbonated, with a large white frothy head. Initial aromas are lightly sweet and funky, with notes of citrus and tropical fruits. Flavours are light, with balance of subtle malt base and citrus sweetness. Initial bittersweet and funky grass and wheat notes mellow quickly into a mild dry bitterness. Light and pleasant with a surprising depth of flavour for those who look for it.
beer_name: Mikkeller / Grassroots Wheat is the New Hops IPA

review_blob: Pours a slightly cloudy light orange / amber with a very light white head. Farmhouse aromas with passionfruit and white wine notes. Medium-high carbonation, with funky flavours of sweet grains and soft fruits, grapefruit finish. Dry on the palette with fairly strong sourness. Light to medium bodied overall, interesting and complex, though perhaps overly carbonated and with a harsh lingering tartness.
tar black with a persistent foamy tan head. Medium-heavy body, medium bitterness with slightly sweet, burnt chocolate flavour and aromas, and a toasty coffee finishing note.

Appearance: cloudy, blonde to golden colour, medium carbonation with light white head.
Aroma: funky, slightly sour and sweet, horseblanket. Slightly pithy citrus notes. 
Flavour and Palate: Light bodied, flavours are slightly sweet and initially quite sour, lightly funky. Slight lingering sourness, pleasant final notes of lemon pith and citrus.

Poured from can, a month from best before. Slightly hazy caramel-orange colour, lightly carbonated, with a light, quickly diminishing white head with lacings of caramel. Aroma is richly hoppy, floral and sweet, with caramel aromas and subtle pine and biscuit notes. Medium bodied, with prominent floral hops giving way to a smooth, solid malt base. Finish is medium to strong bodied, slightly dry with flavours of caramel and pine. There is bitterness throughout but not overly so, and it is nicely balanced and flavoursome throughout.
